pr_title: [ML] Allow stopping DF analytics whose config is missing

timeline.message:
[ML] Allow stopping DF analytics whose config is missing

It is possible that the config document for a data frame
analytics job is deleted from the config index. If that is
the case the user is unable to stop a running job because
we attempt to retrieve the config and that will throw.

This commit changes that. When the request is forced,
we do not expand the requested ids based on the existing
configs but from the list of running tasks instead.

timeline.bodyText:
Can it be that an item will be added twice to matchingItems  because it matches 2 patterns? E.g. item "abc" and patterns "a*" and "ab*"?
Please add a unit test for this case.
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText: It very well can! Well spotted! Fixing.
replies.author: dimitris-athanasiou

replies.bodyText: Ah, I didn't notice the "Set" type, so the code was correct. Anyway, thanks for adding a test!
replies.author: przemekwitek

timeline.bodyText:
IIRC hasItems is a partial match (i.e. it asserts that the actual collection has expected items and maybe some more).
I think org.hamcrest.Matchers.contains should be used instead in order to achieve full match.
timeline.author: przemekwitek
